Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act, 1960  U. P. Act 1 of 1961 -hereinafter referred to as the Act-and can companyveniently be disposed of together.

facts.text: Writ Petition 261 of 1968 challenged vires of Section 6 clause of the Act and was heard along with these civil appeals.

anchor.surface_text: In Writ Petition 261 of 1968 the vires of this provision is challenged. This Writ Petition was heard alongwith these civil appeals and will be disposed of by a separate judgment. In order to appreciate the point a few relevant facts in the case of Civil Appeal No 2018 of 1968 may be given.

facts.text: Inayat Ali Khan filed objections claiming certain plots were used for growing grass or special types of crops for fodder for horses in a specialised farm.

anchor.surface_text: the appellant, Inayat Ali Khan, filed objections. He is a horse-breeder. One objection was that he has a specialised farm and certain plots were being used for growing grass or for growing special types of crops which were used as fodder for horses. He relied on Section 6  xvii  of the Act,

facts.text: Prescribed Authority, Tahsil Sadar, held that the exemption claimed was not sustainable.

anchor.surface_text: The Prescribed Authority, Tahsil Sadar, held that the exemp- tion claimed was number sustainable. The Additional District Judge, on appeal, companycurred. He observed The word and in clause  xvii  of section 6 makes it clear that for purposes of exemption

facts.text: Additional District Judge concurred with Prescribed Authority on appeal.

anchor.surface_text: The Additional District Judge, on appeal, companycurred. He observed The word and in clause  xvii  of section 6 makes it clear that for purposes of exemption it is necessary that the land should be used for specialised farm and should be exclusively devoted to growing such articles or for such purposes as are specified in clause  xvii  and in Rule 4.

facts.text: Appellant filed a revision before the High Court.

concepts.unlisted_label: U. P. Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act, 1960 (U. P. Act 1 of 1961)
concepts.unlisted_description: Act imposing ceiling on land holdings with exemptions under Section 6

anchor.surface_text: He relied on Section 6  xvii  of the Act, which reads as follows Exemption of certain land from imposition of ceiling Notwithstanding anything companytained in this Act, land falling in any of the categories mentioned below, shall number be taken into companysideration for the purposes of determining the ceiling area applicable to, and the sur- plus land of, a tenure-holder- land, other than land used for purely agricultural purposes, included in specialized farm and exclusively devoted to poultry farming or dairying or other such purposes, as may be prescribed Explanation.-Land for the purposes of this clause shall include land, exclusively used by the tenure-holder for growing of fodder for purposes of his dairy. A rule was framed exempting certain farms, and it reads as lows 4 4 .

concepts.interpretation: Land exempt if included in specialised farm AND exclusively devoted to poultry farming, dairying or prescribed purposes; 'and' cannot be read as 'or'; horse-breeding not prescribed

issues.text: interpretation of Section 6(xvii) of the U. P. Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act, 1960 (U. P. Act 1 of 1961)

anchor.surface_text: raise a companymon question as to the interpretation of Section 6, Clause of the U. P. Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act, 1960  U. P. Act 1 of 1961 -hereinafter referred to as the Act-and can companyveniently be disposed of together. In Writ Petition 261 of 1968 the vires of this provision is challenged. This Writ Petition was heard alongwith these civil appeals and will be disposed of by a separate judgment. In order to appreciate the point a few relevant facts in the case of Civil Appeal No 2018 of 1968 may be given.

issues.text: whether the word 'and' in sub-clause (xvii) of Section 6 should, in the context, be read as 'or', and that all specialised farms used for non-agricultural purposes are entitled to exemption

anchor.surface_text: The learned companynsel for the appellant urged that the word and in sub-clause  xvii , should, in the companytext, be read as or, and that all specialised farms used for number- agricultural purposes are entitled to exemption. We see numberforce in this companytention. The sub-clause specially mentions two types of specialised farms, namely, those devoted to poultry farming and dairying. As regards others, it leaves them to be prescribed by rules under Section 44 of the Act.

issues.text: whether the exemption under Section 6(xvii) read with Rule 4 applies to horse-breeding farms

anchor.surface_text: He relied on Section 6  xvii  of the Act, which reads as follows Exemption of certain land from imposition of ceiling Notwithstanding anything companytained in this Act, land falling in any of the categories mentioned below, shall number be taken into companysideration for the purposes of determining the ceiling area applicable to, and the sur- plus land of, a tenure-holder- land, other than land used for purely agricultural purposes, included in specialized farm and exclusively devoted to poultry farming or dairying or other such purposes, as may be prescribed Explanation.-Land for the purposes of this clause shall include land, exclusively used by the tenure-holder for growing of fodder for purposes of his dairy. A rule was framed exempting certain farms, and it reads as lows 4 4 . The following land, included in specialised farms and exclusively devoted for purpose of sericulture, ericulture, lacculture or pisciculture shall, to the extent mentioned below, be exempt under clause  xviii  of Sec- tion 6 land under actual plantation of mulberry, castor and lac-host trees-Kusum, Khair, Palse and ber-which companystitute a grove, land on which buildings, necessary for the rearing of worms or insects producing silk, andi or lac, as the case may be, and for preparation of raw silk, andi and lac, are situate,

arguments.claim: Certain plots in the specialised horse-breeding farm used for growing grass or special types of crops as fodder for horses are exempt under Section 6(xvii) of the Act

anchor.surface_text: One objection was that he has a specialised farm and certain plots were being used for growing grass or for growing special types of crops which were used as fodder for horses. He relied on Section 6  xvii  of the Act,

court_response_anchor.surface_text: ericulture, ericulture, lacculture or pisciculture shall, to the extent mentioned below, be exempt under clause  xviii  of Sec- tion 6 land under actu

arguments.court_reasoning: Lower courts held exemption not sustainable as both conditions not met; Supreme Court agreed with High Court

arguments.claim: The word 'and' in clause (xvii) of Section 6 requires that land be both included in a specialised farm and exclusively devoted to specified purposes (poultry farming, dairying or prescribed) for exemption

anchor.surface_text: He observed The word and in clause  xvii  of section 6 makes it clear that for purposes of exemption it is necessary that the land should be used for specialised farm and should be exclusively devoted to growing such articles or for such purposes as are specified in clause  xvii  and in Rule 4. It cannot, therefore, be said that because this land is being used for growing a particular type of crop it will come under the definition of specialised farming.

arguments.court_reasoning: High Court held lower appellate court correctly interpreted; Supreme Court agreed with High Court

arguments.claim: Land used for growing fodder for purposes other than dairy does not qualify as specialised farming per the explanation to clause (xvii)

anchor.surface_text: In the explanation, appended to clause  xvii , a case of growing fodder has been referred to. This explanation says that the land used for growing fodder purposes of dairy will be exempted. This explanation will, therefore, make it clear that the land used for growing fodder for other purposes will number come under the definition of specialised farming.

anchor.surface_text: The learned counsel for the appellant urged that the word and in sub-clause  xvii , should, in the context, be read as or, and that all specialised farms used for number- agricultural purposes are entitled to exemption.

court_response_anchor.surface_text: bed Authority, Tahsil Sadar, held that the exemp- tion claimed was number sustainable. The Additional District Judge, on appeal, companycurred. He obs

arguments.court_reasoning: Sub-clause specifies poultry/dairying and leaves others to rules under S.44; Rule 4 does not include horse-breeding; impossible to read 'and' as 'or'

arguments.claim: There is no force in reading 'and' as 'or'; exemption limited to poultry/dairying or prescribed purposes under Rule 4 made per S.44; horse-breeding farms not included

anchor.surface_text: We see numberforce in this contention. The sub-clause specially mentions two types of specialised farms, namely, those devoted to poultry farming and dairying. As regards others, it leaves them to be prescribed by rules under Section 44 of the Act. In this context it is impossible to read the word and as or. Rule 4 4  prescribes those specialised farms, but farms used forhorse-breeding are number included.

holdings.text: There is no force in the contention that the word 'and' in sub-clause (xvii) should, in the context, be read as 'or', and that all specialised farms used for non-agricultural purposes are entitled to exemption

anchor.surface_text: We see numberforce in this companytention. The sub-clause specially mentions two types of specialised farms, namely, those devoted to poultry farming and dairying. As regards others, it leaves them to be prescribed by rules under Section 44 of the Act. In this companytext it is impossible to read the word and as or.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Sub-clause specifies poultry farming and dairying explicitly, with others left to prescription by rules under Section 44; literal reading of 'and' required in this context

holdings.text: Farms used for horse-breeding are not included in the specialised farms prescribed by Rule 4(4)

anchor.surface_text: Rule 4 4  prescribes those specialised farms, but farms used forhorse-breeding are number included. We agree with the interpretation placed by the High Court.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Rule 4 prescribes sericulture, ericulture, lac culture, pisciculture, but excludes horse-breeding

holdings.text: The interpretation placed by the High Court on Section 6(xvii) is correct

anchor.surface_text: We agree with the interpretation placed by the High Court. In the result Civil Appeal No. 2018 of 1968 fails.

holdings.reasoning_summary: High Court correctly interpreted requirement of both specialised farm and exclusive devotion to specified/prescribed purposes; aligns with textual and contextual analysis

holdings.text: Civil Appeals Nos. 2018, 2019 and 2020 of 1968 fail as the lands do not qualify for exemption under Section 6(xvii)

anchor.surface_text: In the result Civil Appeal No. 2018 of 1968 fails. The facts in the other two appeals are similar. These must also fail.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Application of correct interpretation of Section 6(xvii) to facts; similar facts in all appeals

anchor.surface_text: In the result Civil Appeal No. 2018 of 1968 fails. The facts in the other two appeals are similar. These must also fail.

outcome.relief_summary: Civil Appeals Nos. 2018, 2019 and 2020 of 1968 fail and are dismissed. Exemption under Section 6(xvii) for specialised farm used for horse-breeding not granted.
